prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: Do you enjoy reading articles about advancements in technology and science?
Sometimes, but it depends on the technology. I am interested in green technology advancements, such as in solar and wind energy. Science itself isn't very interesting to me.
Do you enjoy reading articles about environmental conservation and climate change?
Yes, especially if they're stories that pertain to the region of the United States where I reside.
Do you enjoy reading articles about local politics and community development?

Not really, as I don't follow politics much these days. The toxic debates have left me tired, and I find myself almost apathetic about politics. Possibly community development, but it depends on the subject.
Do you enjoy reading articles about health and wellness, particularly those related to nutrition and exercise?
Yes, I think nutrition and exercise are interesting. I'm curious about new studies about food many of us enjoy, and exercises one can do at home.
Do you enjoy reading articles about personal finance, such as investing, budgeting, and retirement planning?
Not really, as I don't have a savings or retirement. My budget is very tight and I find articles suggesting people set aside thousands for emergencies or investment to be annoying and elitist.
Do you enjoy reading articles about arts and culture, such as music, film, literature, and visual arts?
I do! I enjoy science fiction in particular with film. With music, I usually find myself listening to 90s alternative and classic rock.
Do you enjoy reading articles about travel, specifically about unique destinations and sustainable tourism practices?
Not really, as I can't relate to those articles. I would enjoy watching a documentary or travel video on tv rather than read about new destinations and tourism practices.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: yes

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: This sounds like a very interesting comparison.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: The Atlantic
Title: What Does Sentience Really Mean?
Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I enjoy articles from The Atlantic, and likely would find this interesting.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Bon Appetit
Title: Bon Appetit's Best Banana Bread Recipe
Description: After baking 14 loaves, we aligned on this tender, ultra-moist banana bread as our collective favorite.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I do not cook very often. My wife would enjoy this more than me.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: National Geographic
Title: There’s a new way to tour the Amazon rainforest: by crane
Description: Canopy cranes, once reserved for treetop research, let you see the “eighth continent” like an arbornaut.
evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: Although I don't read tourism articles, I do enjoy National Geographic and this sounds entertaining.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Travel and Leisure
Title: These Airlines Have the Most Luxurious Economy Seats
Description: You can find good Champagne, amenity kits, hot towel service, and wider seats in the economy cabin — if you know where to look.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I cannot relate to most people who tour on their vacations, and this isn't interesting to me.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Popular Science
Title: The right amount of online scrolling could decrease your risk of dementia
Description: A new demographic survey indicates a potential link between regular internet usage and cognitive health in older populations.
evaluation_results.label: yes

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Rolling Stone
Title: All of Nintendo’s Zelda Games, Ranked

evaluation_results.label: yes
evaluation_results.explanation: I really enjoy Nintendo games, particularly Zelda.

Website Name: Sports Illustrated
Title: 2024 NFL Draft: The Six Players Fans Need to Know, Including Caleb Williams

Title: Hang On, Is Artificial Grass Actually Chic?

evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I don't find this interesting at all.

Website Name: Esquire

evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: I'm more interested in older music.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Sunset Magazine
Title: 31 Perfect Recipes for Mother’s Day Brunch.
Description:Make mom’s day extra-special with an elegant homemade brunch. We’ve got your menu covered, from mains to drinks to dessert.
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: This doesn't interest me, as I do not live close to my mother.

Website Name: Vogue

Description: From classic hoops to sculptural drops, these are the earrings you’ll never want to take off.

Website Name: Runner's World

Website Name: Forbes
Title: Killing It
Description: How Two Failed Entrepreneurs Suddenly Began Making Millions Selling Murder Mysteries

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: Tricycle: The Buddhist Review
Title: Why We Look for Happiness in the Wrong Places
Description: Meditation teacher Sharon Salzberg discusses how our yearning for happiness can support us in our journey toward freedom—and why we tend to search for it in the wrong places.
evaluation_results.label: yes

feedback.feedback_other: This was very engaging and fun. Thank you for this experience!

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative yes/no question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the yes/no question and nothing else:
